activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David E. Lassiter Jr.

records.addlTxt:
10:02 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David E. Lassiter Jr. in court.  Attorney Brent Harold Debord appeared by video for David E. Lassiter Jr. 
Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Sowinski states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Debord willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. 
Bail continued.
Defendant reminded to start making attorney fee payments.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
